entry.title: A Tether in the Dark
entry.summary:
Author: ReadNowSleepLater

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 43,764Chapters: 34/34Kudos: 197

Summary: Stiles Stilinski never meant to become a myth.After the fall of his pack and the fading of Beacon Hills’ magic, he runs – straight into a world older, darker, and far more complicated than he ever imagined. Mystic Falls is supposed to be a quiet place to start over, to ground himself again. Instead, it becomes the center of a storm he didn’t know was waiting for him.Drawn into the tangled lives of the Mikaelsons, Stiles finds unexpected warmth among immortals who should’ve terrified him – and something dangerously close to belonging. Between Elijah’s steady grace, Kol’s mischief, Klaus’ possessive charm, and Peter’s return from the shadows, he starts to build something new: a family stitched together by chaos, magic, and a kind of love that defies logic.But magic never lets go without a fight, and neither do old bonds. When ghosts from his past and creatures from the dark rise to claim him, Stiles has to face what it truly means to be an anchor – and what, and who, he’s willing to tether himself to.Because in the end, even in the dark, someone always reaches back.

entry.title: Unwrapped and Stuffed
entry.summary:
Author: Nightowl_22

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,916Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 11

Summary: After a tough year for the pack, Stiles and Derek are finally enjoying the deeper, intense intimacy they've built together. This Christmas, Derek decides to surprise his boyfriend by turning the tables on him. Having overheard Stiles' whispered fantasy about a "slutty Santa," Derek dresses up in a skimpy red velvet outfit, lace underwear, and stiletto boots, determined to tease Stiles until he's the one begging. entry.title: Cuffing Season
entry.summary:
Author: dd0g90

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,132Chapters: 4/10Kudos: 12

Summary: " Cuffing Season" - The time of year between Halloween and, Valentines Day where adults form a couple to get through the lonely holiday season. Most break up February 15th. Stiles is in his last year of college. He recently lost his job as a waiter at a restaurant and,is barely making ends meat as a delivery driver. He's already delayed his education enough paying for a class at a time. When Lydia suggests an app" Cuffing Season" where rich people pay you to date them during the holidays.Stiles is all ears. What happens when he finds out the three men he is dating are related and, invite him to the same holiday party?

Summary: The scent of sun, sweat, joy, cheap laundry detergent, and something sweet that was inextricably Stiles, hit him like a truck going a hundred miles per hour. Relief washed over the anxiousness of the last few days, easing the tension in his shoulders like it had never existed. His animalistic side purred at the feel of friend, pack, family. He wasn’t dreaming, his arms were full of Stiles. Finally. entry.title: The Shackles That Bind Us
entry.summary:
Author: EverythingRara

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,069Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 78

Summary: “How many times do you want me to apologize?” he sighed, shoulders slumping as Deaton studied the runes etched into the old shackles. Derek’s lips curled in a sneer, a growl vibrating low in his chest. “I thought it would be funny!” “You thought cuffing us together would be funny?” And there it was—claws-out Derek in all his irritated glory. “It was supposed to be you and Scott! You know, like a ‘get-along’ T-shirt. Only… cuffs.” “And how is it,” Derek asked, yanking their joined wrists up between them, “that I ended up stuck with you?” Stiles shifted, eyes darting away to the floor. “Scott was too fast—the lock clicked around my hand instead—look, you were there. Why do you keep making me repeat it?” He cringed under Derek’s stare, shrinking in on himself. “Because, Stiles,” Derek said, voice low and promising violence, “I want to make sure you’ve learned your idiotic lesson.” Deaton straightened, expression pinched in that special brand of silent sympathy he reserved for hopeless situations. “Would you like the good news or the bad news?” “The good news,” Stiles said just as Derek growled, “The bad news.”
